pullRequest.title: Removes cloned fdlibm and uses openJDK's fdlibm instead
pullRequest.bodyText:
As discussed in
https://oss.oracle.com/pipermail/graalvm-dev/2020-May/000059.html
Since fdlibm is part of the OpenJDK and can be built as a separate
static library (already shipped with labsJDK) there is no apparent
reason for GraalVM to keep using an older clone of fdlibm.
Closes #2514

nodes.bodyText: Sorry, you cannot change this check. You need to comply with the rules as they are, we also have a separate watchdog that checks all license headers. See my other comment below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -266,8 +266,8 @@
     </module>
   </module>
   <module name="RegexpHeader">
-    <property name="header" value="/\*
 \* Copyright \(c\) 20[0-9][0-9], 20[0-9][0-9], Oracle and/or its affiliates\. All rights reserved\.

 \* FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE\.  See the GNU General Public License
 \* version 2 for more details \(a copy is included in the LICENSE file that
 \* accompanied this code\)\.
 \*
 \* You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License version
 \* 2 along with this work; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation,

 \* questions\.
 \*/
"/>

nodes.bodyText:
The Oracle copyright must remain the first line, the second one is then the Red Hat one. Also, it must be Red Hat Inc. without the ,.
Not my rules, that's what the lawyers agreed on...
When you do the change, please amend your commit and do a force push so that there is no intermediate commit with the wrong license header in the repository.
This definition is no longer necessary, the strictmath library no longer exists.

commit.message:
Removes cloned fdlibm and uses openJDK's fdlibm instead

As discussed in
https://oss.oracle.com/pipermail/graalvm-dev/2020-May/000059.html

Since fdlibm is part of the OpenJDK and can be built as a separate
static library (already shipped with labsJDK) there is no apparent
reason for GraalVM to keep using an older clone of fdlibm.

Closes #2514
